name: N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2787
Reason: The molecular structure of N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine contains a thiopyran ring, which is known to have a high melting point due to the presence of sulfur atoms. The thiopyran ring is connected to a benzene ring through a carbon chain, which adds flexibility to the molecule and can disrupt the crystal lattice, leading to a lower melting point. The presence of two phenyl groups attached to the thiopyran ring also contributes to the high melting point, as they increase the molecular weight and steric hindrance. The diamine functional group at the end of the molecule can also contribute to the melting point, as it increases the molecular weight and adds hydrogen bonding capabilities.
